description: By far the best GUI tool for quickly editing and posting commits.
First thing what I wanted to do with Git Cola, was a Squash: not there. Then interactive commit, couldn't find out how it works. Not intuitive.
After testing a few git GUIs, git-cola is the one I've kept. Very fast, provides quick access to useful options, good visualization. Main drawback: doesn't integrate visually well with GNOME.
summary: Blazing fast and simple git GUI

description: I have no idea that how to resolve conflicts or start mergetool.
I especially like how you can pick and choose changes to go into a given commit (i.e. choose from a line-by-line diff).

The app is ugly and bloated with features. Zero UX.
KDE-like modularization of feature blocks is nice but I would prefer user-tested layout.
History visualization is hidden in menu and shows in a separate window with old graphics, unsorted, just there in case you need it.

App is also NOT UPDATED.

Used git cola for quite some time now. Fairly happy with its GUI and that it's a free GUI for Git, but it keeps freezing and crashing lately. Also there seems to be now easy way to get in touch with the developers, so hopefully they will read this.

When I switched from Windows to Ubuntu on my daily driver laptop I looked for a replacement for SourceTree that is legal to use on commercial projects (so no GitKraken). The combination that I've been using is gitg to view history and Git Cola for everything else. For ~6 months now this has been working very well for me. Git Cola is faster/lighter than SourceTree, and obviously free is better than a paid SaaS (GitKraken). Highly recommend this app.
summary: Excellent Git GUI When Used with a Separate Viewer, e.g. gitg

description: I don't know what the other reviewers are talking about? This installed and opened with no problem, haven't tested the functionality of it yet but appears to be good.
I had a problem accessing private repository and this app had no easy way to add authentication data for particular repo. Others do have this.
summary: No GUI way to add authentication for repos

description:
Quickly identified a project I had running elsewhere on windows, and allowed me to commit what i needed in no time.
Previous application just froze. This did everything I required in 5 mins, and allowed me to keep working without losing any previous commits

Unlike other Git GUIs which are too complicated and indirectly related to git commands, Git-cola is being only a GUI and lets the user do whatever then can with the git commands. It has nice visualization tools. Easy to install and set-off. 
I prefer gitk as an history browser because it lets me invoke diff between past versions.
I've used this for years, it's very simple but has more in-depth functionality if you need it. Won't cover every use case but I'm very happy with it and it's never crashed.
Not supported ubuntu gnome 21.04 :(
This has for far too many years now been my go-to git gui. Clean, simple, does the job without tons messing around! Can't fault it.
The app is simple and must for all devs who use github.
Misses a lot of features compared to other Git GUIs like Github Desktop or even Visual Studio.
This snap doesn't start for me on 19.04.

Fortunately i found this application. 
Thanks a lot to the developers of this applications.

It saves lot of time. Gives clear idea on history.
I found this very useful. has similar utilities to SourceTree
Bei diversen Aktionen startet immer wieder der Git Cola Client und stört damit bei der Ausführung anderer Apps. (Kubuntu 20.04 LTS)
Like it more than gitg
pratique pour gérer ses commits
не разобрался где указать ключ для ssh
Doing its job fast
